intro: Helicophyllum rauwolffii var. kotschyi, commonly known as the Kotschyi helicophyllum, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Boraginaceae. It is characterized by its basal rosette of ovate, hairy leaves and produces striking blue to violet flowers in terminal clusters. The plant is native to the Mediterranean region and thrives in rocky, well-drained soils. It is often found in dry, sunny habitats such as slopes and cliffs. Due to its ornamental value, it is cultivated in gardens for its attractive foliage and blooms.
